Opsomming

AANVULLENDE UITSPRAAK
BRAND AR
/
BRAND AR
:
[1]	Dit het tot my kennis gekom dat ons uitspraak in
hierdie saak wat op 25 Mei 2004 gelewer is ('die uitspraak') 'n syferfout bevat
wat tot 'n berekeningsfout aanleiding gegee het. Die doel hiervan is om dit reg
te stel.
[2]	Die syferfout het betrekking op Rabe se verlies aan
verdienste. In para 68.2 word geboekstaaf dat daar nie met die 'verhoorhof
se
toekenning van R1 906 225 onder hierdie hoof' ingemeng moet word nie.
Soos blyk uit para 2 van die uitspraak, was die
verhoorhof se toekenning onder
hierdie hoof egter inderwaarheid R1 096 225.
[3]	Die
berekeningsfout waartoe hierdie syferfout aanleiding gegee het, verskyn in paras
68.4 en 68.5 van die uitspraak. In hul juiste
vorm moet hierdie paragrawe soos
volg lui:
'4.
Koste van die kurator
bonis
Dit is gemene saak
dat die toekenning onder hierdie hoof gelyk moet wees aan 7,8 persent van die
vorige drie toekennings. Dit is (R1 588 020.70
+ R1 096 225
+ R250 000 = R2 934 245.70 x 7,8%) =
R228 871.16.
5.
Totaal
Hiervolgens bedra die totale bedrag van
skadevergoeding dus R3 163 116.80.'
[4]	In die lig van die
voorgaande word die bevel van hierdie hof in para 70 van die uitspraak vervang
met die volgende:
'[70]	Gevolglik slaag die appèl met koste. Die
verhoorhof se bevel word tersyde gestel en vervang met die volgende:
"Vonnis
word ten gunste van die eiser teen die verweerder soos volg
toegestaan:
(1)	R3 163 116.80 synde skadevergoeding;
(2)	Rente
daarop teen die koers wat ingevolge die bepalings van die Wet 	op Voorgeskrewe
Rentekoers 55 van 1975 voorgeskryf word vanaf
14 	dae na datum hiervan (synde 23
	Desember 2000) tot datum van 	betaling;
(3)	Geen kostebevel word op hierdie
stadium gemaak nie."'

sections.facts: The appellant, Christiaan de Jongh, appealed a High Court judgment dated 25 May 2004 which awarded damages, including a loss of earnings for Rabe and curator‑bonis costs. The original judgment contained a typographical error that recorded Rabe's loss of earnings as R1,906,225 instead of the correct R1,096,225, leading to an erroneous total damages figure.
sections.issues: Whether the appellate court could correct the numerical mistake and recalculate the damages, and whether the appellant was entitled to costs on the appeal.
sections.principles: Courts have inherent authority to correct clerical and calculation errors in their judgments to ensure that awards reflect the correct figures. The principle of accurate quantification of damages requires that any mistake affecting the amount awarded be rectified, and the court may adjust costs accordingly.
sections.application: The court identified the correct loss of earnings figure (R1,096,225) and recomputed the curator‑bonis costs at 7.8% of the three preceding awards (R1,588,020.70, R1,096,225 and R250,000), resulting in R228,871.16. Adding this to the corrected loss of earnings gave a total damages award of R3,163,116.80. The original paragraph 70 of the judgment was replaced with an order granting the appellant success, specifying the corrected amount, interest as per the 1975 interest rate law, and stating that no further costs were to be awarded at this stage.
sections.conclusion: The appeal succeeded; the judgment was amended to reflect the corrected damages of R3,163,116.80, with interest accruing from 14 days after 23 December 2000, and no additional cost order was made.
